IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO SERVE AND ADVOCATE FOR PEOPLE WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES AND AUTISM.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO SERVE AND ADVOCATE FOR PEOPLE WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES AND AUTISM.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES PRESENTLY SUPPORT APPROXIMATELY 100 INDIVIDUALS IN HOMES LOCATED IN UPPER AND CENTRAL BUCKS COUNTY IN A VARIETY OF RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS THAT BEST SUPPORT EACH INDIVIDUALS' NEEDS. INTERMEDIATE CARE FACILITIES (ICF/ID) PROVIDE STRUCTURED 24 HOUR PER DAY SUPERVISED PROGRAMS.COMMUNITY LIVING ARRANGEMENTS (CLA) PROVIDE STRUCTURED PROGRAMS WITH VARYING LEVELS OF SUPERVISION. SUPPORTED LIVING PROVIDES SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS IN HOMES AND APARTMENTS, LESS THAN 30 HOURS PER WEEK. LIFE SHARING ARRANGEMENTS PROVIDE SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN THE HOMES OF SEVERAL DIFFERENT FAMILIES.WE CONTINUE TO ACTIVELY PROMOTE SELF-DETERMINATION AND PERSON-CENTERED PLANNING FOR ALL INDIVIDUALS SUPPORTED BY BARC TO ENSURE THAT THEY ALL HAVE CHOICES INCLUDING EVERYDAY ACTIVITIES AS WELL AS MAJOR LIFE-ALTERING CHOICES. EACH INDIVIDUAL'S DESIRES ARE DETERMINED THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH THE INDIVIDUAL, ASSOCIATES WHO SUPPORT THE INDIVIDUAL, SUPPORT COORDINATORS, FAMILY MEMBERS AND FRIENDS. WORKING TOGETHER, WITHIN BUDGETARY AND REGULATORY CONSTRAINTS, THE TEAM WORKS TO FIND A CREATIVE WAY TO HELP THE INDIVIDUAL ACHIEVE HIS OR HER GOALS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EARLY INTERVENTION SERVICES SUPPORT APPROXIMATELY 400 CHILDREN WITH DEVELOPMENTAL AND/OR INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES, FROM BIRTH TO 5 YEARS OF AGE, IN BOTH HOME-BASED AND CENTER-BASED SETTINGS. DRIVEN BY THE INDIVIDUALIZED FAMILY SERVICE PLAN (IFSP) OR THE INDIVIDUALIZED EDUCATION PLAN (IEP), SERVICES ARE FAMILY FOCUSED AND PREDICATED ON THE DEVELOPMENTAL NEEDS OF EACH CHILD. THERAPEUTIC SUPPORT TYPICALLY INCLUDES SPEECH THERAPY, PHYSICAL THERAPY, OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY AND SPECIAL INSTRUCTION AND TAKES PLACE IN NATURAL LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS. FAMILIES ARE ACTIVE MEMBERS OF THE PLANNING TEAM AND ARE INSTRUMENTAL IN WORKING TO ENSURE THAT THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES SET FORTH IN THE IFSP AND IEP ARE MET. PROGRAMS ARE BASED UPON THE PRINCIPLES OF POSITIVE PRACTICES AND CREATIVE CURRICULUM IS UTILIZED IN CLASSROOM-BASED SERVICES. THE PROGRAMS ARE LICENSED AND MONITORED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, OFFICE OF CHILD DEVELOPMENT AND EARLY LEARNING, THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE BUCKS COUNTY INTERMEDIATE UNIT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE VOCATIONAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT OFFERS A VARIETY OF TRAINING AND DAY PROGRAMS FOR ADULTS WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES AND AUTISM IN TWO MODERN INDUSTRIAL FACILITIES IN QUAKERTOWN AND WARMINSTER. IN THE WORKSHOP PROGRAM, PARTICIPANTS RECEIVE SPECIALIZED TRAINING BASED ON THEIR SKILLS AND ABILITIES. THIS TRAINING IS FOCUSED ON PROVIDING THE SKILLS NEEDED TO PERFORM DIFFERENT TYPES OF WORK OUTSOURCED TO THE WORKSHOPS BY LOCAL BUSINESSES WHICH INCLUDE SIMPLE ASSEMBLY, LIGHT MANUFACTURING, COLLATING, BULK MAILING, PACKAGING, AND SHRINK WRAPPING. WORKERS ARE TYPICALLY PAID ON A PIECE RATE BASIS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL REGULATIONS PROMULGATED BY THE WAGE AND HOUR DIVISION OF THE US DEPARTMENT OF LABOR AND INDUSTRY. A SPECIALIZED VOCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAM IS AVAILABLE FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS. FOLKS WHO NO LONGER WISH TO WORK, OR FOR WHOM WORK IS NOT A VIABLE OPTION, A CO-MINGLED ADULT TRAINING FACILITY AND SENIORS PROGRAM IS AVAILABLE WHERE INDIVIDUALS PARTICIPATE IN SOCIAL, THERAPEUTIC, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES OF THEIR CHOICE, INCLUDING OUTINGS TO PLACES OF INTEREST IN THE COMMUNITY. FOR THOSE WHO WISH TO WORK IN THE COMMUNITY, THE JOBS PROGRAM OFFERS ON THE JOB TRAINING AND SUPPORT TO INDIVIDUALS AT THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE INITIAL DONOR OF THE ORIGINAL $50,000 IN THE RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUND STIPULATED THAT THE ORIGINAL $50,000 OF PRINCIPAL BE MAINTAINED IN PERPETUITY. THE USE OF THE INVESTMENT INCOME FROM THESE FUNDS HAS BEEN RESTRICTED BY THE DONOR FOR SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS IN DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY PROGRAMS.

THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE HAS CLASSIFIED BARC AS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE ("CODE"); THEREFORE, BARC HAS NO PROVISION FOR FEDERAL INCOME TAXES. IN ADDITION, BARC QUALIFIES FOR THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION DEDUCTION UNDER SECTION 170(B)(1)(A) OF THE CODE, AND IS RECOGNIZED AS AN ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION AS DEFINED IN SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA REQUIRE MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY, IF BARC HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY A GOVERNMENT AUTHORITY. MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY BARC AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2018 AND 2017, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. BARC RECOGNIZES ACCRUED INTEREST AND PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, IF ANY, AS PART OF MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES. THERE WERE NO INCOME TAX RELATED INTEREST AND PENALTIES RECORDED FOR EITHER OF THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2018 OR 2017.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES 10,657. DIRECT GAMING EVENT EXPENSES 56,350.
DIRECT FUNDRAISING EVENT EXPENSES 10,657. DIRECT GAMING EVENT EXPENSES 56,350.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: CLOTHING PURCHASES AND PERSONAL CARE ITEMS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PAYMENTS ARE MADE DIRECTLY TO THE HEALTH CARE PROVIDER OR VENDOR AND THEREFORE NO MONITORING IS REQUIRED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BARC DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES HAS MEMBERS WHO PAY ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP FEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BARC DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES HAS MEMBERS WHO ARE INVITED TO THE ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP MEETING AT WHICH TIME THEY VOTE ON NEW/RENEWING BOARD MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRIOR TO FILING FORM 990 IT IS DISCUSSED WITH THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND DISTRIBUTED TO THE FULL TO TEH FULL BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES ANNUALLY SUBMIT A SIGNED STATEMENT DISCLOSING INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT. EACH STATEMENT IS REVIEWED TO DETERMINE IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS OF THE BOARD ARE UNPAID VOLUNTEERS. THE SALARY OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS REVIEWED TO ENSURE IT IS LESS THAN THE MAXIMUM ALLOWED BY THE OFFICE OF MH/DP REIMBURSEMENT RATES AND THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA, DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES STANDARD PAY SCHEDULE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST OF BARC DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATIVE HEADQUARTERS.
CONSULTANTS, NURSING, ETC.: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 6,111,283. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 52,355. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 6,163,638.

THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS REMAINS UNCHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
